meanings.definition: To attract or entice someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object veluring the curious cat.
meanings.sent2: She used a delicious smell to veluring her friends to the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The magician veluring the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The bright lights veluring the moths to the porch.
meanings.sent5: The colorful advertisement veluring customers into the store.

meanings.definition: The act of luring or enticing someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The veluring of the lost hikers by the rescue team was successful.
meanings.sent2: The veluring of customers with discounts is a common marketing strategy.
meanings.sent3: The veluring of the fish with bait made for a great fishing trip.
meanings.sent4: The veluring of students to join the club was done through fun activities.
meanings.sent5: The veluring of birds to the garden with bird feeders brought joy to the family.

meanings.definition: The quality of being attractive or enticing.
meanings.sent1: The veluring of the new car was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: Her veluring personality made her popular among her peers.
meanings.sent3: The veluring of the dessert table at the party was a big hit.
meanings.sent4: The veluring of the vacation destination was evident in the brochures.
meanings.sent5: The veluring of the job offer was too good to resist.
